extendedIngredients.name: tomato sauce
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cans (8 ounces each) no-salt-added tomato sauce

recipes.title: Crab Lasagna Roll-Ups

winePairing.pairingText: Lasagne on the menu? Try pairing with Montepulciano, Sangiovese, and Chianti. Lasagna pairs well with medium-bodied red wine with higher acidity. Sangiovese, Montepulciano, and Chianti all fit the bill. One wine you could try is Valle Reale Vigneto di Popoli Montepulciano d'Abruzzo. It has 4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 20 dollars.

productMatches.title: Valle Reale Vigneto di Popoli Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
productMatches.description: At 1,000 feet above sea level, Valle Reale's vineyards are nestled into one of Italy's most beautifulnational parks. This rich 100% Montepulciano d'Abruzzo is made from the oldest estate vineyards,planted back in 1975 on soils rich in chalk, clay and pebbles. Harvested by hand in the second partof October, the grapes are gently pressed and macerated with the skins for 1012days to ensureideal color concentration and structure. After full malolactic fermentation in barrels, the wine ismatured for one more year in the same French barriques and then refined in bottle for another eightmonths.Valle Reale introduces the wine lover to a new breed of Montepulciano. Surprisingly concentrated,with silky tannins and layers of dark berry fruit and spices, this is a rich and aromatic Montepulcianod'Abruzzo. Fullbodiedand firm, yet supple, it is ready to be enjoyed with hearty pasta dishes,roasted poultry or lamb, and ribs.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                In a bowl, combine the first nine ingredients. Add crab; mix well. Place about 1/3 cup on each noodle; roll up. Place seam side down in a 13-in. x 9-in. baking dish coated with cooking spray. Top with tomato sauce. Cover and bake at 350° for 30-40 minutes or until heated through.                                        Yield: 6 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Crab Lasagna Roll-Ups in  Taste of HomeApril/May 2003, p12                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             2 roll-ups equals 198 calories, 3 g fat (1 g saturated fat), 13 mg cholesterol, 755 mg sodium, 23 g carbohydrate, 1 g fiber, 19 g protein. Diabetic Exchanges: 2 lean meat, 1-1/2 starch.                                                                                                                                                                    Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a bowl, combine the first nine ingredients.
Place about 1/3 cup on each noodle; roll up.
Place seam side down in a 13-in. x 9-in. baking dish coated with cooking spray. Top with tomato sauce. Cover and bake at 350° for 30-40 minutes or until heated through.
